sub_title: Trainee Patent Attorney - Physics, Engineering and Electronics
summary: A few of my interests (in no specific order): metrology, precision engineering, instrumentation, intellectual property, optics (interferometry), lasers, quantum computing & quantum internet, design/preparation and execution of experiments, concept design/low TRL systems, building/designing remotely controlled vehicles, telerobotics, additive manufacturing, micro jet engines and mechanical gyroscopic stabilization.

profile_positions.description: Realization of a demonstrator for proving 'Long distance entanglement generation' over a commercial fiber network between Delft and The-Hague.
profile_positions.title: Systems Architect/Engineer - Quantum Internet Division

profile_positions.description:
Function: experiment designer and test lead for psychophysical i.e. biomedical experiments
Focus: spatial disorientation in aircrew and astronauts.
Keywords: biomedical experiments, spatial disorientation, TNO SDiT (Spatial Disorientation Tool), human centrifuge, hypobaric chamber, 3D-rotation chair, DESDEMONA & AIRFOX ASD motion simulators, parabolic flight, health monitoring [SpO2, EMG, ECG, NIRS, retinal imaging], Aeolus Framework (https://www.aeolus-hpi.org)

Active in:
- Studying push-pull effect during sub-orbital spaceflight using AMST Desdemona
- Research into the minimum human threshold of the Coriolis effect using AMST AIRFOX ASD
- Study of the level of self tilt during partial-G parabolic flight
- Sensory feedback of anti-G straining maneuver during human centrifuge G-training
profile_positions.title: TNO Defence Safety & Security. Department: Human Factors

profile_positions.description:
Function: Systems Architect
Focus: Laser (satellite) communication and Quantum Key Distribution, enabling high data rate and ultra-high security communication respectively.
Keywords: free space optical communication, optical link budgets, optical atmospheric propagation, quantum entanglement, data & communication types, high power lasers, coherent detection.

Active in
- Free Space Optical (satellite) Communication [military and civil use cases]
- Quantum Optics (Quantum Key Distribution)
- Design of Multi-Beam optical communication terminal, i.e. communicating with multiple targets simultaneously from a single platform
profile_positions.title: TNO Technical Sciences. Department: Opto Mechatronics

profile_positions.description:
Attended the 9th conference of the International Association on the Advancement of Space Safety

Presented research on the "Hemodynamic Push-Pull Effect During Simulated Suborbital Spaceflight".
profile_positions.title: IAASS, conference talk

profile_positions.description:
System engineer and experiment leader for a parabolic flight experiment from TNO, researching 'The Perception of Self-Tilt under Different Levels of Partial Gravity'. 
Tasks:
- design & realization of the experimental setup,
- integration into the Airbus A310 Zero-G airplane during the campaign's preparation week end of May 2018, 
- flying as it as experiment leader during three parabolic flights (totaling 93 parabolas and 8 participants) in the 1st week of June 2018; obtaining experimental data during 0.25 g, 0.5 g, 0.75 g and 1.8 g.

The campaign was facilitated by ESA, CNES, DLR and NASA, the project was funded by TNO.
profile_positions.title: Partial Gravity Parabolic Flight Campaign 2018
Parabolic Flight Campaign VP 136, 1st International Space Life Sciences Working Group

profile_positions.description: Optical frequency modulation using electro-optic waveplates.

profile_positions.title: Thesis defence MSc. Biomedical Engineering

profile_positions.description:
A group of 15 selected student investigated the winning mission concept of the Alpbach summerschool (' CARETAKER' mission) with the intention to write a journal publication about this mission.

The mission was redesigned and renamed into: 'Carrington'. The mission's main objective is based upon an optical interferometric system between two spacecraft stationed in Lagange points L4 and L5. The system obtains a CME's magnetic field properties along the line of sight, which are used for determining its geoeffectiveness upon Earth impact.

This post-summerschool was supported by the FFG Österreichische Forschungsförderungsgesellschaft mbH) and the ESA (European Space Agency).
profile_positions.title: Post-Alpbach summerschool 2013

profile_positions.description: Presented the winning mission concept, the CARETAKER mission, from the Alpbach Summer School.
profile_positions.title: 10th European Space Weather Week, conference talk

profile_positions.description:
Summer School organised by: Aeronautics and Space Agency of FFG, co-sponsored by the European Space Agency (ESA), the International Space Science Institute (ISSI) and Austrospace.

Four teams of 15 students from all member states of the EU compete with each other by designing a mission. The topic for the Summer School of 2013 was: 'Space Weather: Science, Missions and Systems'.

I was part of Team Blue, the winning team who's mission called 'CARETAKER' was chosen to go post-Alpbach. During this follow up period the mission will be elaborated by 15 selected students. The result might be presented at a conference or it could become a journal publication.
profile_positions.title: Summer School Alpbach 2013

profile_positions.description: In groups of five, a vision based robot platform was programmed to compete during matches with the robots of other teams.
profile_positions.title: TNO Summerschool 2010
